title: Commemorating the 10th Anniversary of the Farmingdale Titans Youth Football and Cheerleading Organization on January 28, 2011
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commemorating the 10th Anniversary of the Farm-
ingdale Titans Youth Football and Cheerleading Organization  on  January
28, 2011

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to honor organizations
which  faithfully devote their purposeful energies to fostering opportu-
nities for, and to contributing to, the quality of life of the youth  of
the communities they serve; and
  WHEREAS, Athletic competition enhances the moral and physical develop-
ment of the young people of this State, preparing them for the future by
instilling  in  them  the  value  of teamwork, encouraging a standard of
healthy living, imparting a desire for success and developing a sense of
fair play and competition; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is justly proud to commemorate the 10th
Anniversary of the Farmingdale Titans Youth  Football  and  Cheerleading
Organization  to  be  celebrated  at  its Annual Awards dinner at Stuart
Thomas Manor in Farmingdale, New York, on Friday, January 28, 2011; and
  WHEREAS, The Farmingdale Titans Youth Football and Cheerleading Organ-
ization has proudly completed its 10th season of providing  an  environ-
ment  in  which  fair  play,  respect and sportsmanship are held in high
regard; and
  WHEREAS, The Annual Awards dinner will celebrate  yet  another  trium-
phant  season  by honoring all of the athletes and community members who
have contributed to this remarkable  organization's  continued  success;
and
  WHEREAS, The Farmingdale Titans Youth Football and Cheerleading Organ-
ization  is  under  the able leadership of Bob Thompson, President; Eric
Rosch, 1st Vice President and Equipment; Laura Cincotta,  Officer;  Tina
Gangale, Officer; Marty Hettrich, Officer; Rob Rodriguez, Officer; and
  WHEREAS,  The  hallmarks  of the Farmingdale Titans Youth Football and
Cheerleading Organization are both a brotherhood  and  a  sisterhood  of
athletic  ability,  of  good sportsmanship, of honor and of scholarship,
demonstrating that these team players are second to none; and
  WHEREAS, Sports are a wholesome activity for the young people of Farm-
ingdale, New York, and our Nation, involving children, teenagers, coach-
es, parents, sponsors and other interested men  and  women,  helping  to
build  character  in  young  competitors through the lifelong lessons of
sportsmanship and competition learned on the field; and
  WHEREAS, Sports competition instills the values of teamwork, pride and
accomplishment; the Farmingdale Titans Youth Football  and  Cheerleading
Organization  has  clearly made a significant contribution to the spirit
of excellence which is a tradition of their community; and
  WHEREAS, It is the custom of this Legislative Body that  those  organ-
izations  which  enhance  the well-being and vitality of their community
and have shown a long and sustained commitment to  excellence  certainly
have  earned  the  recognition  and applause of all the citizens of this
great Empire State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
commemorate  the  10th Anniversary of the Farmingdale Titans Youth Foot-
ball and Cheerleading Organization  on  January  28,  2011;  and  be  it
further
  RESOLVED, That copies of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted  to  Bob Thompson, President and to the Farmingdale Titans Youth
Football and Cheerleading Organization.
